data.title: Independents in Local Government
data.meta_description: The 2021 local elections saw Independent, Resident Association and Green councillors again win seats from the big parties and make significant gains across the country. This factsheet sets out where our Group Members are running councils and working hard on the backbenches to make a difference for their residents.
data.text:
Councils with an LGA Independent Group Leader

As of July 2021, there are 35 councils across England and Wales with a Leader that falls within the membership of our group, namely:

Councils with LGA Independent Group Members in the administration

As well as those we lead, members of the Group are part of the administration in another 34 councils across England and Wales, meaning members are in the administration of 69 councils in total.

The 34 councils are listed below, a number of which are coalitions with shared leadership arrangements:

Councils with LGA Independent Group Members

In total LGA Independent Group members have been elected to represent local people in 307 authorities across England and Wales, that’s 92 per cent of the total number of councils in England and Wales.

You can see how many of these have declared a Climate Emergency

The full list of where our members have been elected is below:
